title: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) etc. These classes show up prominently in the Open Type dialog.
OB: When accessing the Open Type dialog, obfuscated classes such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', and 'd' are displayed.
EB: The Open Type dialog should exclude obfuscated classes and only display non-obfuscated classes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Launch the software.
2. Access the Open Type dialog.
3. Observe that obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) are displayed.
